question: Which 80s rock anthem features the lyrics 'We built this city on rock and roll'?
funFact: We Built This City by Starship was released in 1985 and became a number one hit.

question: Which 80s rock anthem features the lyrics 'It's the eye of the tiger'?
funFact: Eye of the Tiger by Survivor was the theme song for Rocky III and reached number one in 1982.

question: Which 80s rock anthem features the lyrics 'Don't stop believin', hold on to that feelin''?
funFact: Don't Stop Believin' by Journey became one of the best-selling digital songs of all time.

question: Which 80s rock anthem features the lyrics 'Whoa, we're halfway there'?
funFact: Livin' on a Prayer by Bon Jovi was released in 1986 and became one of their signature songs.

question: Which 80s rock anthem features the lyrics 'I want to rock and roll all night'?
funFact: Rock and Roll All Nite by KISS was originally released in 1975 but became a major hit in the 80s.

question: Which 80s rock anthem features the lyrics 'We're not gonna take it'?
funFact: We're Not Gonna Take It by Twisted Sister was released in 1984 and became an anthem of rebellion.

question: Which 80s rock anthem features the lyrics 'I love rock 'n' roll'?
funFact: I Love Rock 'n' Roll by Joan Jett & the Blackhearts was released in 1981 and spent seven weeks at number one.

question: Which 80s rock anthem features the lyrics 'Pour some sugar on me'?
funFact: Pour Some Sugar on Me by Def Leppard was released in 1987 and became one of their biggest hits.

question: Which 80s rock anthem features the lyrics 'Here I go again on my own'?
funFact: Here I Go Again by Whitesnake was released in 1987 and became a number one hit.

question: Which 80s rock anthem features the lyrics 'Welcome to the jungle'?
funFact: Welcome to the Jungle by Guns N' Roses was released in 1987 and became one of their signature songs.

question: Which 80s rock anthem features the lyrics 'Sweet child o' mine'?
funFact: Sweet Child o' Mine by Guns N' Roses was released in 1988 and reached number one on the Billboard Hot 100.

question: Which 80s rock anthem features the lyrics 'I wanna know what love is'?
A: I Want to Know What Love Is
funFact: I Want to Know What Love Is by Foreigner was released in 1984 and became a number one hit.

question: Which 80s rock anthem features the lyrics 'We will rock you'?
funFact: We Will Rock You by Queen was originally released in 1977 but became a major stadium anthem in the 80s.

question: Which 80s rock anthem features the lyrics 'I'm still standing'?
funFact: I'm Still Standing by Elton John was released in 1983 and became a top 10 hit.

question: Which 80s rock anthem features the lyrics 'Jump'?
funFact: Jump by Van Halen was released in 1984 and became their only number one hit on the Billboard Hot 100.

question: Which 80s rock anthem features the lyrics 'Take on me'?
funFact: Take On Me by a-ha was released in 1985 and became famous for its innovative music video.

question: Which 80s rock anthem features the lyrics 'Every breath you take'?
funFact: Every Breath You Take by The Police was released in 1983 and spent eight weeks at number one.

question: Which 80s rock anthem features the lyrics 'Billie Jean'?
funFact: Billie Jean by Michael Jackson was released in 1983 and became one of the best-selling singles of all time.

question: Which 80s rock anthem features the lyrics 'Beat it'?
funFact: Beat It by Michael Jackson was released in 1983 and featured a guitar solo by Eddie Van Halen.

question: Which 80s rock anthem features the lyrics 'Thriller'?
funFact: Thriller by Michael Jackson was released in 1983 and became the best-selling album of all time.

question: Which 80s rock anthem features the lyrics 'Like a virgin'?
funFact: Like a Virgin by Madonna was released in 1984 and became her first number one hit.

question: Which 80s rock anthem features the lyrics 'Material girl'?
funFact: Material Girl by Madonna was released in 1985 and became one of her signature songs.

question: Which 80s rock anthem features the lyrics 'Girls just want to have fun'?

funFact: Girls Just Want to Have Fun by Cyndi Lauper was released in 1983 and became a feminist anthem.

funFact: How Will I Know by Whitney Houston was released in 1985 and became her first number one hit.
